title: Improve first experience with repository README & Vagrant
body:
Closes #343  #320 #366 

Summary of changes:
- Main README short to quickstart, points to simple setup using vagrant [tools/vagrant/simple/](tools/vagrant/simple/)
- Main README points to a custom setup using vagrant [tools/vagrant/custom/](tools/vagrant/custom/)
- There is a README for simple very very short, and a README for custom more instructions on how to customize db using cloudant or couchdb with one command 
- Move data store details to README in [tools/db/README](tools/db/README)

title: Diet for whisk/scala image
body:
`whisk/scala` was way too big for what it is, let's trim it a bit.
- Not installing JDK but a Server JRE
- Not installing scala as it isn't used

Gets `whisk/scala` from 1.3GB to 378.4 MB
- Using a better suited base image, while still using `trusty` under the hood
- Consolidated common installation step to use docker caching more efficiently
- Not using `apt-get` for nodejs anymore
- Not using `maven` for downloading `slf4j` anymore
- Removed unnecessary setup steps from `.travis.yml`

title: Guard to avoid an NPE if a post fails, and print the error
body:
Supersedes #303:

Guard against undefined response and body in HTTP requests from action or trigger activation.
Normalize error message to include the error code in the error string.
Remove rawLog and replace with console since 'whisk' instance was not using rawLog and there's no real value to doing this.
Move packages from package.json to Dockerfile to make clear these are part of packages available to actions and not required otherwise to run the action supporting harness.
Order the packages in the Dockerfile by name.
Add gm package to reference doc.

title: WIP: Allow Swift actions to optionally be declared inside a struct
body:
OpenWhisk actions are expected to declare a global "main" function. However, this does not work well if you want to develop multiple actions in a single Xcode target, as you cannot re-declare a global main function.

This solution suggests that users working in Xcode may optionally declare their main function inside a struct, in order to solve the namespacing issue at compliation time. Just before the .swift code is run, if a struct declaration is found, peel away the struct to reveal the main function contained inside.

title: Add kafka path
body:
Add a kafka path from the invoker back to the loadbalancer component of the controller.

On each activation completion the invoker sends a CompletionMessage back.  For now, this contains just the activation id.  The loadbalancer, on receipt, simply prints this in the log for now.  No other action is taken for this PR.  Also extend signature to include topic that is being handled for when multiple topics are handled by the same handler.

Related to Issue #142. PPG 382 passed.

title: Rewrite logging logic to wait for sentinel marker
body:
For nodejs action containers which are managed, use the generated sentinel marker to determine that the logs for the activation have fully flushed.  Heretofore, we were using it for post mortem debugging but we have cases showing that indeed the logs are not always flushed quickly by docker.

title: Add notion of sid to extend tid
body:
Activity occurs in the invoker (probably others) not necessarily as a result of a transaction.

Background activity can be logged using an `sid_NNN` in the log messages to give greater
information.  Most `dontcare` have been replaced by more meaningful values with the few remaining
cases named to `unknown`.

PPG 350 - passed.

title: issue #197 restructure ansible deployment. using modes for deploy, clean, initdb
body:
adding roles for prereq and postdeploy as well as db role for local CouchDB.

issue #197 introduce deploy and clean mode for each role

issue #197 ignore errors on cleanup. invoker mounts provoke some device busy errors.

issue #197 remove logs on cleanup.

issue #197 don't create retry files

issue #197 merge loadbalancer into controller. remove loadbalancer role.

issue #197 createImmortalDBs, generate whisk.properties, env for travis

issue #197 install ansible via pip on travis.

issue #197 travis does not like us using port 53. changing back to 8600. we are not using consul dns anyway atm.

issue #197 fix cli test

issue #197 fix whisk.version.name and whisk.version.date

issue #197 fix db prefix if hostname has uppercase letters

issue #197 add db role to launch CouchDB if needed.

issue #197 generate db env file to make ant build happy.

Signed-off-by: Hoang Anh Le hoang@de.ibm.com

title: Rewrite putBack to respect invariant to improve perf
body:
The pause operation (along with other infrequent ones) were occurring inside the synchronized block.  Rewrote the method to follow expected invariant (no slow op inside sync).

Passed PPG 346.

title: Improve 2 tests
body:
1. Print out activation record in case of failure to help debug intermittent failure.
2. Remove an extra check that is measuring time that is already measured (activation) and is too strict because it gives no allowance for sanitize/create.  Moreover, redundant with junit-level timeout.

title: Fix transaction id to be explicit and mutable within Container
body:
Transaction id was neither propagated nor maintained correctly.  Making the field explicit and mutable (as container warmed up by the system can be used by a different transaction) fixes the missing ???.  

Moreover, even before the recent warmup work, containers were being reused and the lack of updating the implicit transaction id parameter led to associated docker operations being mis-attributed.

Remove the default dont_care parameter for SimpleExec so that caller must supply one.
